channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2024020076
item.description:
Report E-2024020076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN1760 were leaking from the bungs and released approximately less than one (<1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services (EHS) to remediate the impacted site. Crews wiped down the released product with cleaners and absorbent pads. EHS personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack, and the one (1) undamaged 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack were placed onto a pallet and gift wrapped for return to the terminal. Crews took one (1) poly liner of the absorbent pads and cleanup debris back to their shop.

item.title: Report X-2024010764
item.description:
Report X-2024010764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs with vented caps in inner corrugated carton with top corrugated liner inside outer corrugated carton with other plastic jugs and corrugated liner. Liquid leaked through vent on one cap, soiling jugs and damaging cartons. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024010788
item.description:
Report X-2024010788

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. came to QA on the IC belt wet, went to do damage and noticed inner cartons had limited Quantity diamond labels on inner boxes pulled sds and section 14 transportation information stated it was corrosive so placed in hazmat cage to get inspected. DescribePack: Closures came loose on inner bottles which caused the liquid to leak out and soil outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report X-2024010783
item.description:
Report X-2024010783

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic bottles in corrugated carton. No filler or padding. Bottles sealed with plastic bung. Bottles crushed and leaked, damaging carton. No visible damage to bottles other than crushing. Leak possibly due to ice expansion in product during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024010719
item.description:
Report X-2024010719

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered by a manager on the load side during outbound at 5:38pm. The manager called QA who picked up the hazmat and placed it in the fumigator in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The air relief cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020014
item.description:
Report X-2024020014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: COMMERCE CITY
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONED TO THIS LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WEARING ALL PPE. PACKAGE WAS HANDLED ACCORDING TO THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS AND WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
